dcterms:creator: Lucas Caccia
Rahaf Aljundi
Tinne Tuytelaars
Joelle Pineau
Eugene Belilovsky
dcterms:description: Split CIFAR-10 typically partitions the dataset into 5 disjoint tasks containing two classes each. In this work, the authors also consider partitioning into 10 disjoint sets (1 class each).
dcterms:title: Split CIFAR-10

dcterms:creator: Lucas Caccia
Rahaf Aljundi
Tinne Tuytelaars
Joelle Pineau
Eugene Belilovsky
dcterms:description: Split CIFAR-100 consists of 100 classes typically split into 20 tasks, each containing a disjoint set of 5 labels. In the one-class incremental work, the authors also consider the case of splitting into 100 distinct task switches.
dcterms:title: Split CIFAR-100
